---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [2744823e6e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21671/commits/2744823e6e68052af11328f48cec2493bbf390f1)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ hasSum_log_one_add`
`+ le_log_one_add_of_nonneg`
`+ lt_hasProd`
`+ lt_log_one_add_of_pos`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Here's a golf:
```
@[to_additive]
theorem _root_.lt_hasProd {ι α : Type*}
    [OrderedCommMonoid α] [MulRightStrictMono α] [TopologicalSpace α] [OrderClosedTopology α]
    {f : ι → α} {a : α} (hf : HasProd f a) (i : ι) (hi : ∀ (j : ι), j ≠ i → 1 ≤ f j)
    (j : ι) (hij : j ≠ i) (hj : 1 < f j) :
    f i < a := by
  classical
  calc
    f i < f j * f i := lt_mul_of_one_lt_left' (f i) hj
    _ = ∏ k ∈ {j, i}, f k := by rw [Finset.prod_pair hij]
    _ ≤ a := prod_le_hasProd _ (fun k hk ↦ hi k (hk ∘ mem_insert_of_mem ∘ mem_singleton.mpr)) hf

/-- Expansion of `log (a + 1)` as a series in powers of `a / (a + 2)`. -/
theorem hasSum_log_one_add {a : ℝ} (h : 0 < a) :
    HasSum (fun k : ℕ => (2 : ℝ) * (1 / (2 * k + 1)) * (a / (a + 2)) ^ (2 * k + 1))
      (log (a + 1)) := by
  have key := hasSum_log_one_add_inv (inv_pos.mpr h)
  rw [inv_inv, add_comm, add_comm _ a] at key
  exact key.congr_fun fun k ↦ by field_simp

lemma lt_log_add_one_of_pos {x : ℝ} (hx : 0 < x) : 2 * x / (x + 2) < log (x + 1) := by
  have key := lt_hasSum (Real.hasSum_log_one_add hx) 0 (by intros; positivity)
    1 (by positivity) (by positivity)
  field_simp at key
  exact key
```
Seems that existing results in mathlib uses `log_one_add` i.e. `log (1 + x)`. Would you like to swap the order of your result?
Yes, maybe it's best to stick to the conventions used elsewhere (though `x + 1` looks a bit more natural to me, constant terms of polynomials generally being written on the right)

oops, I meant to delegate this before.

bors merge
This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried
Thanks for this! Please wait for CI before merging.
Thanks for this! Please wait for CI before merging.

I think this result is still true when `a = 0` (in this case the infinite sum has only one term). Not sure what if `-1 < a`.

Also, maybe the `Real` in  `Real.hasSum_log_one_add_inv` can be omitted? (Same as the result below.)
Hmm, `hasSum_log_one_add_inv` requires `0 < a`, I just added a `nonneg` version of the final result instead.
You can use `by_cases ha0 : a = 0` to give an alternative (possibly very simple) proof in `a = 0` case. I'm not sure the case `-1 < a < 0`, clearly it requires another proof...

```suggestion
  have key := lt_hasSum (hasSum_log_one_add hx) 0 (by intros; positivity)
```
(if you like; untested)

```suggestion
/-- Expansion of `log (1 + a)` as a series in powers of `a / (a + 2)`. -/
```
There is another mistake of docstring in the existing part of this file, a few lines above I think, where `hasSum_pow_div_log_of_abs_lt_1` should be `hasSum_pow_div_log_of_abs_lt_one`. If you like, you can fix it as well.
Now the docstring doesn't match the theorem (`a + 1` vs `1 + a`).

There's nothing fundamentally wrong with these proofs, I just wanted to showcase a few tactic features in case you weren't familiar with them:

1. you can use `rfl` in `obtain` to substitute equalities automatically.
2. you can use `convert` to provide a term which almost matches the goal, and you will be left with differences. You can use `using n` to limit the depth of the match to `n` (so it isn't overly eager).

```suggestion
  obtain (rfl | ha0) := eq_or_ne a 0
  · simp [hasSum_zero]
  · convert hasSum_log_one_add_inv (inv_pos.mpr (lt_of_le_of_ne h ha0.symm)) using 4
    all_goals field_simp [add_comm]
```
Thanks!

Likewise
```suggestion
  convert le_hasSum (hasSum_log_one_add hx) 0 (by intros; positivity) using 1
  field_simp
```

```suggestion
  convert lt_hasSum (hasSum_log_one_add hx.le) 0 (by intros; positivity)
    1 (by positivity) (by positivity) using 1
  field_simp
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Analysis): lower bound for `log (1 + x)`
